newsitem.title: USA: Pilots' union declares strike is likely.
newsitem.headline: Pilots' union declares strike is likely.

text.p: Allied Pilots' Association President James Sovich said Friday negotiators for the union and American Airlines were still far apart and a strike set for midnight was likely to go ahead.
"They're nowhere near us on economic or job security ... it's likely we'll be striking," Sovich told a news conference.
Sovich said he had expected more movement as the deadline neared on a walkout that would ground the nation's No. 2 carrier.

"We think it's ridiculous that we're still this far apart three hours before the deadline," he told reporters. Asked if the airline was softening its negotiating position, Sovich replied "No" but expressed hope talks would continue even if the strike went ahead.
Sovich had no word on whether President Clinton might intervene to impose arbitration to avert a strike and he cautioned the carrier against counting on it.
"It would not be the smartest move to count on the White House to do it. Number one, they may not, and number two, even if they do it is not a settlement," he said.
